page.title: 20WORK IN BACKWELL
page.content: Most Backwellians go to work in Weston and Bristol, which are the neighbouring towns. Weston is a seaside resort and Bristol is a large industrial town. There are three ways to travel, bus,train and taxi. The train fare to Bristol is Â£1.20 single, to Weston it is Â£1.40. The bus fare to Bristol is 90p return. Going by car means you usually get caught in the rush hour, i.e. @8.00 a.m. and 5.30 p.m. When you go by train you have tp pay on the train itself. The station is only small and you have to go on an overpass to get from one side of the railway to the other. There is a lot of graffiti on the walls of the three shelters at the station.
